poem:
**Marmalade Extravaganza**  

In the Cumbrian dawn, sheep—orange and unapologetic—   
wander among diplomats, bridging jars of golden tang   
into a language all can taste. A squirrel, aglow, stands witness   
to Paddington's parade, while the choir lifts voices, coated in citrus,   
sending marmalade dreams spiraling like sugar   
on toast, uniting the world.
